Pre-Game Insights: Algeria and Angola begin their TotalEnergies CAF Africa Cup of Nations Côte d'Ivoire 2023 on Monday, with so much expected from both sides.
It’s redemption time for the Fennec Foxes, who are eager to impress after a shambolic 2021 run in Cameroon.
Captain Riyad Mahrez and his colleagues aim to make amends by going past stiff opposition in Angola before handling the other two in the group - Burkina Faso and Mauritania.
Algerians will look for inspiration from Milan's Ismael Bennacer, who has become an important part of the squad after sustaining a knee injury.
Islam Slimani, playing in his sixth TotalEnergies CAF AFCON, Said Benrahma (West Ham), and Houssem Aouar (Roma) are among the key talents for Algeria.
Djamel Belmadi has a lot of quality to tap from in the Algerian squad.
Pedro Goncalves, the Angolan coach, has the task of navigating past the North African opposition.
Angola is making their ninth AFCON appearance and their first since 2019.
Breezing past the group stage is an important morale booster for the Palancas Negras, who are in Côte d’Ivoire without M’bala Nzola (Fiorentina).
Jérémie Bela of Ligue 1 side Clermont is a key player for Angola.
Angola reached the quarter-finals in 2008 and 2010 (which they hosted) and hope to do better in Group D.
Angola's recent attribute of not being heavy scorers yet not conceding is a potential negotiating tool for opponents.
Pre-tournament predictions favor Algeria, but Monday’s game could go either way.
Head-to-Head: Algeria has recorded two wins (1985 and 2001), while Angola has recorded just one win over Algeria (2006 World Cup Qualifiers).
Six of their encounters have been drawn games, the last one being the 0:0 game in the group stage of the 2010 TotalEnergies CAF AFCON.
